| History                 = '''Parallel Conglomerate''' was a subsidiary company of [[Rand Corporation (Earth-616)|Rand Meachum Corporation]],{{r|Namor the Sub-Mariner #29}}{{Verify source}}<!-- confirm the operation mentioned is Parallel or something else --> involved in oil business.{{r|Namor the Sub-Mariner #4}}

After finding a treasure chest of valuables from an old Spanish brigantine, Namor informed [[Carrie Alexander (Earth-616)|Carrie Alexander]] that he would use the wealth to buy Parallel,{{r|Namor the Sub-Mariner #1}} turning it into '''Oracle Incorporated'''{{r|Namor the Sub-Mariner #3}}{{r|Namor the Sub-Mariner #4}} (sometimes described as Oracle buying out Parallel).{{r|Namor the Sub-Mariner #2}}{{r|Namor the Sub-Mariner #29}} Namor intended the company to benefit Earth's environment and inform its surface dwellers of the consequences of their actions. amor granted the establishment to [[Caleb Alexander (Earth-616)|Caleb]] and Carrie Alexander, who later resigned.{{citation}}

[[Human Torch (Android) (Earth-616)|Jim Hammond]] became Head of Security for the firm,{{r|Namor the Sub-Mariner #31}} before rising to the rank of CEO and using the corporation to fund a new iteration of the Heroes for Hire, to fill the void left after Onslaught killed the Avengers.{{r|Heroes for Hire #1}} In this role, Hammond briefly fell under the sway of the villain known as [[Eshu (Earth-616)|the Master]] before being rescued. However, when Oracle, Inc. was bought out by [[Stark Industries (Earth-616)|Stark-Fujikawa]], Jim Hammond and the Heroes quit on moral grounds.{{r|Heroes for Hire #19}}

The role of CEO fell to the cryptoantiquarian [[Marduk (Earth-616)|Nestor Zoltan]], who used the company to sell arms to [[Underground Liberated Totally Integrated Mobile Army To Unite Mankind (Earth-616)|U.L.T.I.M.A.T.U.M.]], as part of a larger scheme.{{r|Citizen V and the V-Battalion #3}}

After the events of [[Secret Wars]], the group known as [[Squadron Supreme (Earth-616)|Squadron Supreme]] killed [[Namor McKenzie (Earth-616)|Namor]], and [[Kyle Richmond (Earth-31916)|Nighthawk (Kyle Richmond)]] bought the company.{{r|Squadron Supreme Vol 4 2}}
